Name: Tower Fifth
Notes: Tower Fifth is a slender office tower proposed by 432 Park Avenue developer Harry B. Macklowe of Macklowe Properties , would become the second tallest tower in the Western Hemisphere after One World Trade Center if completed as planned

Name: 350 Park Avenue
Notes: 350 Park Avenue has been quietly proposed by Vornado Realty Trust after a marketing brochure leaked renderings ; the Foster and Partners -designed building would replace BlackRock 's current headquarters after the company moves to 50 Hudson Yards in 2022

Name: 80 South Street
Notes: As of June 2019 , the site is for sale after Chinese developer Oceanwide Holdings ran into financial difficulties

Name: 270 Park Avenue ( reconstruction )
Notes: JPMorgan Chase plans to demolish & replace its headquarters ; the new tower was approved by the New York City Council in May 2019

Name: Tribune East Tower
Notes: Would become the second-tallest building in Chicago upon completion

Name: 15 Penn Plaza
Notes: Proposed by Vornado prior to the financial crisis of 2007-2008 ; as of 2019 the developer is still seeking an anchor tenant to justify construction . New renderings leaked from a marketing brochure in June 2019 depict a tower around 1,400 feet ( 430 m ) with a new design

Name: 2901 Arch Street - Transit Terminal Tower
Notes: Proposed office and retail

Name: Dallas Smart District Tower
Notes: Proposed office tower would be the tallest in Texas and tallest west of the Mississippi River

Name: 333 South Figueroa
Notes: Proposed hotel by Shenzhen New World Group , tallest proposed tower West of Mississippi River

Name: 400 Lake Shore Drive South Tower
Notes: Currently stalled due to objections from Alderman Brendan Reilly

Name: 520 West 41st Street
Notes: Proposed in 2014 by World Trade Center developers Silverstein Properties but put on hold ; new plans as of June 2019 depict a shorter two-towered development

Name: 3101 Market Street ( Part of Schuylkill Yards )
Notes: Proposed residential , office , education , and retail

Name: 300 Biscayne
Notes: Announced in 2015 . It will be one of the tallest buildings in Miami and the state of Florida

Name: One Bayfront Plaza
Notes: Announced in 2010 . One Bayfront Plaza would be the tallest office tower in Miami and Florida

Name: SkyRise Miami
Notes: A vertical entertainment center in Miami . Site work has begun as of October 2018

Name: One Brickell City Centre
Notes: Proposed in November 2013 and approved in 2014 with estimated completion in 2020

Name: 4/C
Notes: Proposed in September 2015 by Crescent Heights , designed by LMN Architects

Name: 247 Cherry
Notes: SHoP Architects building being developed by JDS Development Group . Initial plans revealed in April 2016 and approved by the City Planning Commission in December 2018

Name: 262 Fifth Avenue
Notes: First proposed in June 2016 ; as of June 2019 no site work has been completed and the developer has not released any updates

Name: Figueroa Centre
Notes: Proposed residential , hotel , and retail - would become the third tallest building in Los Angeles
